intro: Galipea panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian galipea, is a small evergreen tree native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Galipea panamensis is often found in lowland tropical forests and plays a role in local ecosystems.
